crypto

Class OTP

  • java.lang.Object
    • crypto.OTP

  • public class OTP
extends java.lang.Object
    A collection of methods to encrypt data via OTP-Blacklight.

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      OTP(java.io.File otp)
      Create a new encryption manager using a pregenerated OTP.
      OTP(java.io.File f, java.lang.String randData, java.lang.String filename)
      Create a new encryption manager and generate an OTP using bytes read from a file salted with a collection of random data.
      OTP(java.lang.String randData, java.lang.String filename)
      Create a new encryption manager and generate an OTP using a collection of random data.

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      void advance()
      Deletes used parts of the OTP.
      java.lang.String decrypt(byte[] ciphertext)
      Decrypt a given byte[] using the set OTP.
      byte[] encrypt(java.lang.String plaintext)
      Encrypt a given string using the set OTP.
      java.io.File generateOTP(java.io.File f, java.lang.String randData, java.lang.String filename)
      Generate an OTP using bytes read from a file salted with a collection of random data.
      java.io.File generateOTP(java.lang.String randData, java.lang.String filename)
      Generate an OTP using a collection of random data.

      • Methods inherited from class java.lang.Object

        clone, equals, finalize, getClass, hashCode, notify, notifyAll, toString, wait, wait, wait

    • Constructor Detail

      • OTP

        public OTP(java.io.File otp)
        Create a new encryption manager using a pregenerated OTP.
        Parameters:
        otp - The OTP to use.

      • OTP

        public OTP(java.lang.String randData,
           java.lang.String filename)
        Create a new encryption manager and generate an OTP using a collection of random data.
        Parameters:
        randData - The data to use.
        filename - The name to use for the OTP file.

      • OTP

        public OTP(java.io.File f,
           java.lang.String randData,
           java.lang.String filename)
        Create a new encryption manager and generate an OTP using bytes read from a file salted with a collection of random data.
        Parameters:
        f - The file to use to create the new OTP. Can be anything, but will cause a RAM overload if it's too big.
        randData - The data to salt the file with.
        filename - The name to use for the OTP file.

    • Method Detail

      • generateOTP

        public java.io.File generateOTP(java.io.File f,
                                java.lang.String randData,
                                java.lang.String filename)
        Generate an OTP using bytes read from a file salted with a collection of random data.
        Parameters:
        f - The file to use to create the new OTP. Can be anything, but will cause a RAM overload if it's too big.
        randData - The data to salt the file with.
        filename - The name to use for the OTP file.
        Returns:
        The newly created OTP file.

      • generateOTP

        public java.io.File generateOTP(java.lang.String randData,
                                java.lang.String filename)
        Generate an OTP using a collection of random data.
        Parameters:
        randData - The data to use to generate the OTP.
        filename - The name to use for the OTP file.
        Returns:
        The newly created OTP file.

      • encrypt

        public byte[] encrypt(java.lang.String plaintext)
        Encrypt a given string using the set OTP.
        Parameters:
        plaintext - The text to encrypt.
        Returns:
        The encrypted text as a byte[].

      • decrypt

        public java.lang.String decrypt(byte[] ciphertext)
        Decrypt a given byte[] using the set OTP.
        Parameters:
        ciphertext - The byte[] to decrypt.
        Returns:
        The decrypted text as a string.

      • advance

        public void advance()
        Deletes used parts of the OTP. Run after every usage of encrypt() as soon as you have a transmission receipt from the recipient.
